meanings.definition: Unable to be assuaged or relieved
meanings.sent1: The child's unassuageable crying kept the parents awake all night.
meanings.sent2: Her unassuageable grief over the loss of her pet was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The unassuageable hunger of the dog led it to raid the pantry for snacks.
meanings.sent4: The unassuageable storm raged on, refusing to calm down.
meanings.sent5: The unassuageable pain in his knee made it impossible for him to walk.

meanings.definition: Not able to be pacified or calmed
meanings.sent1: The unassuageable toddler threw a tantrum in the store.
meanings.sent2: Despite his efforts, her unassuageable anger towards him persisted.
meanings.sent3: The unassuageable cat refused to be comforted by anyone.
meanings.sent4: The unassuageable sea roared with unrelenting waves.
meanings.sent5: The unassuageable fire blazed out of control, scorching everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: The unassuageable itch on his back made him squirm uncomfortably.
meanings.sent2: The patient's unassuageable pain required stronger medication.
meanings.sent3: The unassuageable thirst after exercise was finally quenched with a cold drink.
meanings.sent4: The unassuageable fear of spiders made her scream at the sight of one.
meanings.sent5: The unassuageable loneliness in her heart lingered despite her efforts to socialize.
